author: edwint
title: World of Pirates
description: Most gamers have no idea what Cardano Blockchain is and are not aware of the games on Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal aims to increase Cardano adoption by creating a free to play game that could attract new users.  The team is already working on this concept part time and is requesting funds to keep the project moving forward and hire additional team members. Successfully implemented, I can see how it would make a positive impact in the ecosystem and drive adoption for this segment of users.  
I rated this proposal 4 stars because if executed well it will make a positive impact on the adoption of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has proposed a clear timeline to complete the project around Q1 2024 with milestones to complete each quarter prior to that date.  I appreciate that the budget is defined by category and per hour by line item.   After reviewing the bios provided, it is clear that the team has technical skills along with interest and experience in gaming.  Their website is well designed and contains quality art related to the project.  I do not have expertise in game development, but the target of Q1 2024 seems realistic for this type of game.
The team acknowledges the difficulty of game development in creating a quality game that is fun to play without the resources of AAA gaming studios.  They are hopeful the potential funds will allow them to hire some skill sets not currently on the team and improve their chance of success.
The team transparently noted they may require further funding to complete this project.
The team has provided a discord where they give updates on their progress.
In summary, while creating a successful game is a difficult and ambitious target, the team does have both technical and creative skills and a realistic timeline/budget.  I believe it's likely this proposal could be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has set targets for both the development of the game by quarters and metrics to track the adoption of the project by tracking KPIs like NFT sales, social media engagement, monthly active users, etc.  It seems reasonable that the community can audit progress of this project through Discord and social media updates related to the team's timeline.

f6_assessments.q0:
The videogames have been experiencing incredible growth for years, so they are an excellent tool to attract people to cardano. The freemium mode is currently ideal for nft games, as having to convince a new player to install a cardano wallet is easier than having to make an upfront payment. And the goal is for more people to have their own cardano wallet. 
The games they are combining are all very popular at the moment. Both chess and card games. The latter have had an important growth since the release of Hearthstone by Blizzard.
f6_assessments.q1:
They developed in detail the use of funds between the different areas to develop the game, where most of the money goes to the development of the game itself. Which is the most important area in any video game development (I am a information technology graduate).
The team has members with extensive experience in the area of game development. Although I consider that it would be important some link to a social network so that this experience is verifiable. There is no link to linkedin, twitter or any other social network.
As a negative point, they are working on another project, so they will not be able to devote all their energies to the current project.
f6_assessments.q2:
They provide a set of important metrics to audit the nft game development process, the most important points being the number of total players, the number of active players and the total number of nfts sold.
Although among the metrics they mention is that the game is self-sustaining. But there is no information regarding any concrete metric of how many nfts sold per quarter would reach this goal. Or any other type of metric that is correlated with the game being self-sustainable.
On the other hand, it would be important to clarify the prices of the nfts that will be for sale. There is a mention of the price in the first part, but it is not clear. And at the time of auditing the progress, regarding the sale of nfts. Without a reference price, the price of the nfts could be reduced in order to meet the sales goals.

Meanwhile, the team also outline possible risk and also provide the solution which shows a lot of prudence and a sense of reality. f6_assessments.q0:
Proposal fit the challenge. A free and strategic card game project that can be played with friends. I welcome projects like this because Cardano currently has a shortage of really good and engaging games. Making it difficult to compete with other blockchain ecosystems of games and gaming communities.
You mentioned your goal to get players to learn about your game and the technology behind it, and to raise awareness and the Cardano ecosystem. I think you need to explain in detail about this little part, the method that you will use to achieve this. Because I think this will be very difficult, most gamers look to games for fun and maybe just to make money for Play-to-Earn games. To be able to get them excited about the technology behind it. , you need a method to accurately identify potential audiences - people who really intend to learn but they don't know where to start, maybe through questions in the game, thereby bringing them closer. with Blockchain and Cardano.
The game is more about fun than rigorous brainstorming. So I hope there won't be any "Pay-to-win" feature here, it's a double-edged sword that kills many projects. And if the Gamefi trend explodes again, you need to be really calm and sober, because your game should develop slowly but safely. A lot of Gamefi projects are caught up in the Play-to-earn craze and become "junk" after the trend ends, leaving many investors empty-handed and the project will be scandalous and discredited.
After all, the project is quite understandable with the aim of creating a game that is not too inclined to make money but it is entertaining and free. I have no comment because I think most of the information provided is satisfactory, above are some of my tips for the project, hope you listen. I rate this part highly.

f6_assessments.q0:
The instigators of this proposal plan to bring more people into the Cardano ecosystem by developing and releasing their game ‘World of Pirates.’ This fits within the framing of this Dapps, Products & Integrations challenge in that they wish to drive more adoption and give people reasons to interact with Cardano blockchain.
In Summary, the game is a turn-based strategy card game, initially free to play and then players can choose to invest in the NFTs provided. A nice connection they have already implemented is during ‘Pawn of the Month’ competitions they partnered with Sea Shepherd and 50% of the money gathered was donated to this reputable cause. They plan to continue this sponsorship model and support organizations that fight to change or improve something, particularly environmental concerns.
My concern with this proposal’s possible impact is the game itself. Card based strategy games are not the ‘mainstream’ of gaming, more a niche market that will need to be tapped into. So in turn, the impact is lessened as the potential customer/client base is limited by the number of people interested in these types of games. The gaming market is hoped to be significant player within blockchain and potential client base in the Cardano ecosystem, some estimates are that there are 2.5billion gamers world wide, we just need to ensure Cardano projects are going to be adaptable for a large proportion of those potential players.
Overall, this proposal could have a small impact, bringing a niche market of gamers into the Cardano ecosystem. I give it 3 stars in the impact category.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal contains enough details about the timeline, budget, staffing and success criteria to acknowledge it’s feasible.
The team have provided a brief timeline, even though the question did state ‘detailed timeline’, however, further along in the auditability piece they have given further details. Combining these two sections, they have many objectives set aside for each quarter. Given this isn’t a totally new project, there is a great website and resources already in place, which lend credit to the team being able to continue the development once funding is granted. It would be interesting for them to detail how they would ‘increase awareness of Cardano’ in the game itself, or would it maintain as just a little logo when you scroll to the bottom of the website?
The budget / staffing breakdown is simplistic, but does list the planned salaries and expenses. One concern is the high hourly rate listed for the Game Developer and Music Composition, however, later in the explanation they describe planning to hire two junior developers. For clarity’s sake it would have been clearer to state that obviously. 
Their existing team has a wealth of knowledge and experience directly correlating to the development plan for ‘World of Pirates.’ They list a social media manager type person, which will be vital to promoting the game towards success, but don’t have a salary listed - but perhaps that is being funded by another proposal or another company?
A last feasibility note is that they realize they will probably need to return to Catalyst for further funding rounds to develop a fully successful and sustainable game. I guess voters are being asked to fund this proof of concept game, to which then further deployment financing might be needed.
Overall, I give this project 4 stars for feasibility given the team’s development progress so far and evident commitment to their project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal lists a commendable list of statistics that will be proof of progress towards the ongoing success. They include metrics such as NFTs sold, player numbers and social media engagements. They have set numerical goals for each of these criteria, initially aiming to have >20 players in 2022, to a total number of active players >100,000 in December 2023. 
Although they have this detailed list, they’ve not documented where this information will be shared with the Cardano community and those funding this proposal. A simple page within their website, or even just more details on the ‘Roadmap
 Section could add confidence and support to their delivery of outcomes. Similarly, some sort of financial accountability and ledger for funders to see the spending and money distribution plans along the way.
Overall, there are a lot of ways to audit this proposal’s success, but the proposers have not made it easy or obvious to find this information going forward, for this reason I give it 3 stars for auditability.
f6_assessments.reply: Very good points and some harsh ratings, but we accept them.

solution: World of Pirates puts the gamer first by providing a fun online free-to-play game, that any gamer can play without paying a dime! We want to bring awareness to gamers about blockchain gaming.
experience:
We are a team of 8 people with experience of many years of game, web2 & web3 and blockchain development, illustration & art concepts, marketing, startup growth, and promotion.
Currently, we are able to bootstrap ourselves part-time and now we are looking for funding.
